config_name.label: Acquisition Name
config_name.description: The name given to the acquisition for future reference.

sampling_rate.label: Sampling Rate
sampling_rate.description: The sampling frequency of the graph. Availables values depends on the target devices capabilities.

decimation.label: Decimation
decimation.description: Decimation reduces the sampling frequency. A decimation of N means that 1 sample every N samples isacquired while all the other are discarded.

effective_sampling_rate.label: Effective Sampling Rate
effective_sampling_rate.description: The real sampling rate computed based on the selected sampling rate and decimation.

probe_location.label: Trigger Position (%)
probe_location.description:
When the trigger condition gets fulfilled for the given hold time, a trigger event happens.
This parameter control the position of the trigger event in the acquisition window. A value of 0% will put the trigger event on the left of the acquisition. 50% in the middle and 100% at the far right.
Useful to see before or after an event.

timeout.label: Acquisition Timeout (s)
timeout.description: Timeout from the trigger event before the end of the acquisition. A value of 0 means "no timeout" and acquisition will finish once the buffer is full

ideal_time.label: Ideal time
ideal_time.description: Time deduced from the sampling frequency. Uniform sampling is assumed and uses no space in the datalogging buffer. Not available for variable frequency rates.

measured_time.label: Measured Time
measured_time.description: Time measured by the device. Depending on the device configuration, sampling may or may not be uniform. Requires a 32bits slot in the datalogging buffer.

signal.label: Watchable
signal.description: Any watchable object given by the server. Drag & drop any Variable/Alias/RPV from a watch or list widget

xaxis_signal.label: X-Axis Signal
xaxis_signal.description: The watchable object to use as the X-Axis. Any variable, alias or runtime published value (RPV) can be dropped in this field

true.label: Always True
true.description: Does not wait on any condition. Returns a graph as soon as the buffer is full

description.html:
Check the change between 2 samples of x1 to be greater than x2. The change dx1 must be in the same direction as the sign of x2
|dx1|>|x2| & sign(dx1)=sign(x2)

When x1 is close to x2 with a tolerance of x 3.
(|x1-x2|<|x3|)
The operand x<sub>1</sub>. Can be a constant or a watchable. Any variable, alias or runtime published value (RPV) can be dropped in this field
The operand x<sub>2</sub>. Can be a constant or a watchable. Any variable, alias or runtime published value (RPV) can be dropped in this field
The operand x<sub>3</sub>. Can be a constant or a watchable. Any variable, alias or runtime published value (RPV) can be dropped in this field

trigger_hold_time.label: Hold Time (ms)
trigger_hold_time.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds (fractional value possible), that the trigger condition must be true without interruption before launching the trigger event that will cause the acquisition to finish eventually.
